Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: CRBug
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean room. Well maintained grounds. Can't say anything about pools, it was too cool when we were there. Only $55 a night for a room with a king bed. Cons: Wireless internet did not work in room. We were told "the company is coming tomorrow to update the system. We can put you in a room next to the laundry and try it there" Are they joking? Noise: Okay, you are next to a major freeway. The air conditioner/vent unit drowned out the sound of the freeway. I agree with another reviewer - watch the safe charge. Other places I have stayed have made it an option up front. The fact that this company puts it on your bill and you have to catch it seems very underhanded. Breakfast: Okay, so if a cup of coffee gets you going in the morning this is okay. To us, a waffle is not going to hold you for a day of sightseeing. We walked to the Valley Kitchen Restaurant instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: googoo4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located for our Concert at Copley Hall, downtown. It also accepted our pet (dog) for an additional $20. Still the total for the night was under $100. Coffee was always available at the office as were Otis Spunkmeyer cookies. They offered a hot waffle and cereal for free at breakfast. The room was adequate with 2 queens. The shower spray was weak. Free wired or wireless internet was included. All in all a good value for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: phxmom4
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights with my daughter & my mom - a girls' only trip to celebrate my mom's 83rd birthday. We had a standard room with 2 queen beds. Room was clean & roomy & recently renovated. Granite countertops in the bathroom & on the tv stand/dresser & bedside table - - impressive for this price range. Had a microwave & small refrigerator. The continental breakfast was adequate (great waffles!). The location was great & very centrally located. Beware of $2/day fee for in-room safe. I told them at check-out we did not use it & it was removed from our bill. Pillows were hard & towels not the best, but all in all, a fantastic value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Be Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ProPetSitter210
Reviews.Content: Great value for your buck! I was worried about the motel's cleanliness & safety when I booked since I got a cheap rate, but it's a genuinely nice deal! Friendly staff and, best of all, the room was clean. In fact, I happened to sneak a peek inside a room on my way to check-out and noticed housekeeping actually changing the sheets. Hey, it's a big deal if you've heard some of the horror stories out there. WiFi worked great once you call the front desk for the code. Bus stop right out front (Route 88) and there's always a taxi nearby since it's a strip full of hotels/motels. My room was about four doors down from the front desk so I felt safe. It was quiet at night. Great location, too. I would definitely stay again if I'm ever in San Diego. By the way, I love SD!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice I could have made”
Reviews.Author: Querida_Ge
Reviews.Content: Since September 2009 I've been required to stay once a week in San Diego in the Mission Valley neighborhood. I tried a couple of hotels in the area before I settled for the Vagabond Inn Hotel Circle, and intend to stick to it. The rooms have been nicely remodeled not long ago, are well equipped with very useful mini-fridge, microwave oven, coffee maker and safe. I really like to work using the desk by the window in the king bedroom I usually stay in. The staff has accommodated all of my requests so far, and I love the waffles in the morning. I can even work by the pool in the back, the setting is really nice. This hotel is a great deal and great place to stay. I strongly recommend it. I'd also stay there if I go back with my family for a leisure trip. Well done, hotel team!

Reviews.Title: “Superior for Cleanliness, Hospitality, Service and Pet-Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RobFinter
Reviews.Content: I had to spend over 3 weeks with my 2 adult german shepherds at the Vagabond Inn on Hotel Circle. The rooms are updated, clean, and the grounds, 2 pools & hot tub are spotless. The staff is incredible. Better stay than any I've had at a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: azpainterman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all the hotels on hotel circle in this price range, and the vagabond inn stand above the rest. Frequenting the San Diego area on business, it was nice to stay at a place where the rooms were clean (without that odd smell that you just can't place), everything worked, and the staff was courteous: not mention the DELICIOUS WAFFLES. This is the only place I will stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GregB99
Reviews.Content: Nice place and I enjoyed my stay. Rooms where very clean. Only problem was with the TV remote and I had no hot water on Tuesday morning Oct 6 of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe and clean.”
Reviews.Author: strongforward
Reviews.Content: Nice room, clean. The remote control was temperamental. I would stay there again. The price could be less.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel61791
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Vagabond Inn was so great! The workers were very polite and well dressed. The room was very clean and organized, and I will definitely be returning to this hotel for future stays. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay at an affordable price. I was very satisfied with my whole stay. It was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' jacuzzi room @ a gr8 location for an awesome rate”
Reviews.Author: Dennielouise
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to S.D. Natural History Museum to view the BodyWorlds exhibition with my husband, son, and 2 friends and needed a cheap, bedbug free, breakfast providing hotel that was close to the museum and beaches. With a Jacuzzi Suite for approx. $120 Vagabond Inn clinched the deal. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised at our friendly service at check-in and how clean our rooms were. (We booked 2 rooms a standard 2 queen for $55 and the jacuzzi suite). They were not huge but w/ limited space and la-di-da granite countertops the hotel managed to make the queen room cozy enough and despite a few yucky looking black spots in the bathtub it was alot better than a few other hotels I've stayed @. But the suite...whew! what a beaut! Welcome basket with 2 bathrobes, slippers, 4 cd player with surround sound, vanity mirror, mood lighting, dvd player, flatscreen plasma t.v., basically everything the website promised AND the toilet paper was folded into and origami bouqet of flowers...My gf and I screamed in excitement! For a change this cheapy hotel room actually got better and better...The location was great! We got to Coronado for a spectacular sunset in about 20 min. and to the museum next day in 8. We all noshed on good sushi, put my son to bed, then us 3 friends lounged w/ Mr. Bubbles, music, dimmed lighting, and The Captain till late. The bfast wasn't anything to write home about although the waffles were good. But I could've done without a snarky comment from an employee asking if I had come back for 2nds. Cuz yes I usually feed my son and hubby first and seeing as I am limited on how much I can carry back to the room, yes I will be back (gasp!) a 2nd time to humbly feed myself on 1/2 a waffle and a coffee..but I angrily digress. Seeing how close we were to Balboa Park and since our request for a late checkout was granted, we had ample time to sunbathe and swim in one of the 2 heated pools before taking showers and heading out. Overall it was a smash...LOVED IT!!!! Def. recommend to others and will return hopefully for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, lots of extras for no extra cost”
Reviews.Author: docentksb
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Vagabond. Both stays have been better than you would expect for the low price tag for a clean room with lots of extras that are included: free wifi, mini fridge with freezer and microwave, safe big enough to fit a laptop, coffee in room, free waffle breakfast in the mornings, two pools to chose from and a hot tub, plus more. Location is excellent to get to all the San Diego attractions and downtown plus tons of shopping/dining within one highway exit for anything you might need. We ended up extending our trip and extra day and they couldn't have been more helpful with arrangements and pricing. We also have a 9 1/2 month old baby, everyone was really nice to us and made us feel really welcome. We're tough critics and have stayed all over the country at high end and low end hotels. We really like this Vagabond and highly highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “HOagy's Heroes thank Vagabond Inn”
Reviews.Author: britbigduck
Reviews.Content: The Vagabond is a great place to stay. I stayed at the Vagabond as one of a group of charity riders ... Hoagy's Heroes who were riding from San Diego to Jacksonville to benefit the children of veterans. The rooms were excellent and very clean with comfortable beds. The swimming pools (Two) were both very clean and very well maintained. Even the hot tub was super clean which is different from most public hot tubs I have seen. The 'make-your-own' waffle breakfast was a very welcome change from the bland continental breakfast served by so many less welcoming hotels. All in all I had a great stay and want to thank Vicki and her staff for making us welcome.

Reviews.Title: “reliability tremendously consistent”
Reviews.Author: demeigh27
Reviews.Content: The office staff provided great customer service. Management kept their promises over a 4 month time span, great credibility. Vicky in reservations created value for me. We had 20 guests who all enjoyed the updated facility and breakfast bar. Best hotel/motel experience by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Vegascat1
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego for the first time on vacation. A friend had suggested hotel circle as a good area to stay and boy, were they right! Fantastic location - no more than 10 minute drive to beaches, Coronado, Sea World and the zoo. The hotel room was large and when we asked for a quiet room away from the freeway, the desk clerk upgraded us to a room at the back with a small balcony overlooking the pool. The balcony was very nice to have to sit out and enjoy the breakfast and relax in the evening. It would be worth the $10 more they wanted on the website. Room was comfortable enough. Air conditioner was loud but that's pretty normal for rooms without a central unit. The towels were nice and soft. Staff were extremely pleasant an helpful. Good direction sheet they provide to get to all the sites. It was a great value for the price. Only complaint was we wished they offered fat free milk with the breakfast - they only had whole milk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: asmalls69
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent the weekend in San Diego and chose the Vagabond Inn in Hotel Circle. My wife stayed in a Vagabond Inn on the way to Oregon a month ago and wanted to give it a shot. Being a former hospitality manager and having 20 years experience in the business I agreed with her assessment as word-of-mouth is what keeps these hotels moving. My wife made the reservations the night before and when we arrived they remembered my name and the rapport was immediate. I had worked in five-star hotels before and this was not like them. The true measure of any hotel is the staff, and they have a good one. They are helpful and respecful of the guests as well as the rules they must adhere to. The rooms are clean and the pool(s) and hot tub were great. Customer service is on par with any hotel I have worked in. The only complaint is that if they took two rooms and mad them into breakfast rooms, they would have hit a home run. Being they are in the middle of everything most people may pass up on the breakfast, but their customer service was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: benner4
Reviews.Content: This may not be a posh hotel, BUT it was really nice! It was totally remodeled, totally clean and it was convienient, had 2 pools (and they were heated), a spa, vending machines, pretty landscaping, a great FREE breakfast every morning, around the clock fresh coffee and fresh fruit. They have tons of different types of rooms for everyone's needs, from one bed, 2 beds and bunk beds, even THREE beds in a room! I don't know about you but I have never even seen a hotel/motel with 3 beds in a room! The last thing I wanted to comment about was Vicky the Manager! She was so sweet, helpful and caring. She made making the reservations not only easy but when I was being cheap about what kind of room I wanted she didn't make me feel cheap, instead she was very accomadating. Then when I checked in she gave me un upgrade to a room with a balcony....just because! I would SO recommend this hotel AND I will definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!!”
Reviews.Author: damtwo2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, great value, easy on the budget, the main deskman is very personable friendly and accomadating, can't say that for all of them.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant staff; close to many sites”
Reviews.Author: darlenealmeida
Reviews.Content: Vagabond Inn has a very pleasant and accomodating staff. Room was clean and had a complimentary frig and microwave. The hotel has two pools and a hot tub; complimentary breakfast with waffles and cereal was a plus. Hotel a ten minute car ride to Old Town, and within 20 minutes of many beaches.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: kirstenBoston_Ma
Reviews.Content: Outside looked like older building but the room was modern and well decorated. Room was extremly clean and comfortable...beds and pillows were perfectly great.Staff was so nice and smiled when you said hello. Front desk people seemed ready to bend over backward to help satisfy a request. We stayed only for 2 days . The kids loved the breakfast and pool. I booked on line for 99.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: RubinL124
Reviews.Content: My wife saw this ad in Westways Magizine, so we tried it again and were very pleased with our stay. The rooms had been redone. Very clean. We had a coffee maker, a microwave and a refrig. The people at the front desk (especially LEO) were very plessent, helpful and accomadatihg. All in all we were pleased and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not extravagant.. but workable”
Reviews.Author: gjoline
Reviews.Content: We had booked our hotel under a different hotel, but I guess expedia switched it up on us without me noticing it and we got stuck here. For a romantic weekend get away with your fiance, I would not reccomend this. There wasn't much privacy, cuz as you walked outside you could see the front desk and parking lot from our room. Also, I wasn't a fan of the signs that said if you steal a towel or wash cloth or pillow you would be fined "x" amount. There also was a sign that said that you had to use a cosmetic towel (it was colored) if you washed off your make-up or cleaned up a stain. I did not like that, a doesn't hotel provide you the towels and don't ask "please dont' stain us, or we'll charge you." I was so worried about getting fined that I couldn't fully enjoy my stay with my fiance. However, when we went to speak with the hotel staff they were COMPLETELY helpful and friendly and improved our experience greatly. Plus the hotel was conveniently located next to a mini-mart and a 24 hour resturaunt. Had I been staying for a night passing through or on a business trip- this would be completely favorable.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, clean, great place !”
Reviews.Author: BrownieTucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on 4th of July weekend, 2009. The location is really good, easy to access I-5, I-8 and 1-163. We had our dog with us. The hotel is right next to I-8, and we were wondering how easy it is for our dogs....Surprisingly, they have a nice natural area for pets behind the hotel. Our dog enjoyed morning and evening walk just behind the hotel ! The service at the front desk (all of them are great but I know only one person's name, Leo) was wonderful, room was clean, very convenient location, pet friendly, and reasonable prise. We would go back again !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: 3hapitravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. We were pleased with the central location to everything. Our room was impeccably clean and was very comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to friends or family who were staying in the area. Only one minor complaint - the free wi fi internet only worked if we sat out by the pool. For some reason the signal was too weak in our room. But other than that we were very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: QCteacher
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for a nation in need. Paid $30 more by not booking from the internet.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: travelinchic1
Reviews.Content: The beds are too firm, not enough towels and the tub/shower needs to be replaced. Upon going to the room that was initially given to us was not ready they were in the middle of cleaning the carpets so they switched us to another room but it was a standard room because they didnt have any more upgraded rooms left because they were having a problem with the laundry??? Maybe thats why the sheets were dirty, one bed had small blood spots on it and the other had a black dirty mark. We asked for new sheets and they came the NEXT DAY to give us them!!!! but they made us down grade to a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes away from ALL attractions, afordable, comfortable beds, and modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sweetgal2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here, very close (under ten minutes) from beaches, Sea World, and SD zoo. We stayed in a standard double queen, very affordable, beat the prices of all other hotels within the same area. The rooms were very clean, new carpet, all new modern furniture with granite counter tops in the vanity, bedside table, and TV stand. Brand new fridge, stainless steal microwave. The beds were comfortable (pillow top) as advertised. Hot water, which is always a must, decent size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: cshellcshore
Reviews.Content: we always stay at the vagabond on hotel circle every time we visit san diego because we have a pet and we want to stay somewhere nice and clean. vagabond has definitely improved it's appearance quite a bit over the last couple of years. the best part of the stay is the complimentary continental breakfast, which serves make your own waffles, cereal/milk, orange juice, fruit and coffee and tea. it really is a delight to stay at the vagabond!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and friendly customer service!”
Reviews.Author: hotlas
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel and it was great. I was able to bring my dog and my baby and we all had a great time. If you like friendly service at a competitive price look no further. This is great hotel; clean an close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “A Surprisingly Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cher19
Reviews.Content: A lower priced hotel but very clean with microwave and fridge, two heated pools and hot tub and nice helpful professional staff made our trip go well since we were forced to stay overnight due to high winds along the highway home. It was also great that they allow dogs and this was a great selling point for us but the fact that it was so clean and relatively quiet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE AND CLEANLINESS”
Reviews.Author: checol
Reviews.Content: Also great client service, i remember the name of the revenue manger (alondra) great person, with good qualities with the clients. the prices are very competitive, a mean, good fares for the services and all things. I complete recomended this hotel Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, friendly staff, great price, wonderful accomodations, will come again and refer others.”
Reviews.Author: slpscp98
Reviews.Content: Our family arived at the Vagabond Inn Hotel Circle South, San Diego, on Thursday, 04/23/09, and departed on Saturday, 04/25/09. Prior to our arrival, I spoke with Vicky on the phone to make my reservations. She was professional, friendly, courteous, and extreemly accomodating. Vicky provided us with a terrific rate and we will come again as a result of her level of customer service. Upon our arrival, the front desk associates were friendly and courteous, making our checking easy and effortless. We appreciate the excellent service proviced by Leo Mearadith as well. We were provided the keys to room 201, the Kids Suite and it was clean and relaxing. Our children slept comfortably and so did my husband and I. Thank you to all of the Vagabond staff that made out stay pleasant and enjoyable. Our room was a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “hotel very worth the price”
Reviews.Author: denazz
Reviews.Content: Look online for the best rates for this hotel. very worth it. nicer room than expected. very quiet. heated pool was nice, especially since it was windy. plenty of parking spaces. waffle breakfast served too early (6-9am) so could'nt try it. would definitely come back to this hotel. right next to old town and very close to downtown sd.

Reviews.Title: “Older motel, updated rooms, friendly staff but would stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: fishfood8
Reviews.Content: Our room was right by the freeway, but in the room you could not hear road noise. But the noise outside the room got a bit annyoning from the young people next door, when they were hanging out. The pool was warm, but they would not heat up the jacuzzi, even after I asked every day for 3 days, and even spoke to the maintenance man about it. On the last night, they promised to heat it up, but it was still too cold for me and the other guests I spoke to, at about 95 degrees. The manager said that was legally all they have to heat it up to. He said he would turn it up to 100, but it never got hot. Our refrigerator was on the wrong switch, so our food spoiled the first night, the management bought us a few sodas to compensate. Everyone was very helpful and friendly and the room was decent, but I would still choose to stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: tarch588
Reviews.Content: My family and I recommend this hotel, with particular regard for Khaliq, who was the front desk person working during the arrival for our stay. Thorough and professional in his presentation and demeanor, he guided us through the check-in process, helped us in directing some particulars during our planned stay - especially with regard to a couple of local trips in the area we needed to make with a four year old in tow, and generally well represented the Vagabond Inn so that we will make accomodations there on our next visit to the San Diego area. Well done, Khaliq.

Reviews.Title: “It's a cheap, funky(not in a good way) motel.”
Reviews.Author: CasimirsCabinet
Reviews.Content: I had higher hopes for this place for sure. Apparently it was remodeled recently, but it still resembles a very cheap, dive of a motel. I wanted to check out the minute we got to the room. The floor had big dark stains on the carpet, the rooms were miniscule! And the beds, like laying on a plywood plank. I really wished I had checked out and not even given it a shot, because it was the WORST sleep of my life. So uncomfortable, The beds had itchy thin sheets, lumpy pillows, and were just awful. The staff was very courteous and helpful in every way, but that hardly made up for the beyond poor accommodations. They do have a heated pool which is neat, and kept very warm, but it's not monitored, even though it's RIGHT next to the main office. There were people making out IN the pool with kids swimming around right next to them. It was a bit appalling. I honestly wish I had not been frugal and spent the extra hundred bucks on a quality hotel downtown. I will not be staying here again, no way no how. It's fine if you just need ANY place to stay and couldn't care less if you can hear your neighbors washing their hands and sneezing, but if you're expecting any semblance of decency, go somewhere else. It's a slummy little hotel and definitely looks much better online than in person, sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: johnica
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a dumpy hotel for the price I was quoted. The room was just remodeled with new amenities like a safe, microwave, TV, etc. The room was clean and modern. I would definitely stay again, however next time I would ask for a room farther away from the freeway. They could've used some newer windows when they did the remodeling. Staff was friendly and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mom2-5lilmonkeys
Reviews.Content: We received the best treatment by the staff at the front desk - Meredith and Jennifer! We arrived after a long day on the road, having previously reserved a room with one queen and a bunk (top single, bottom double), and decided we definitely needed a little more space from our five children. Jennifer and Meredith went the extra mile to hunt down joint rooms for us, and were able to offer a rate that was resonable (more than what we would have paid for the one room, of course, but not as much more as you might expect). They were fast, friendly, efficient, and very helpful. The rooms were incredibly clean, tidy, and spacious. Even the lot was immaculate. We ended up being in smoking rooms to get the adjoining space, yet there was NOT A HINT of cigarette odor. If we were in the area again, we would most definitely stay at the Vagabond Inn on Hotel Circle again!

Reviews.Title: “Good motel”
Reviews.Author: AnkiGeelong
Reviews.Content: For the price the hotel is recommended. We stayed for 4 nights. We had a room with 2 queen beds. Rooms were clean. No issues with parking. Breakfast was very good. And one morning when we were late for brekky with our toddler the staff quickly got out fruit, cereal and milk for us when they saw us coming in even without us asking. Found staff to be very helpful. Only negatives is that I thought the room was slightly on the small side compared to other motels we had stayed at and the lighting is quite dim in the bathroom. Our plug was stuck in the bath and wouldn't drain. We reported it that evening and it was fixed the next day. There is a convenience store next door and also a diner. We did find it odd though the lack of restaurants or fast food outlets on Hotel Circle given how many hotels and motels there are. Maybe there were some but we didn't see them. Nevertheless we found places to eat in nearby areas and also ate at the diner next door. Would quite happily recommend Vagabond Inn Hotel Circle.

Reviews.Title: “There are very few establishments with the value this motel offers.”
Reviews.Author: mpathic
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many moels, but this is one of the best for the money. Spent weeks at a time and come back, frequently. Staff is courteous, helpful and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating, helpful and friendly and responsive towards my situation”
Reviews.Author: freedom232
Reviews.Content: The employees of this hotel were wonderful. I did not come to San Diego on a business trip or for pleasure. My Mother and I came to San Diego due to her having a medical issue and her needing surgery at the University California San Diego Hospital. The hotel was able to provide me with a discounted rate because of my situation they showed concern for my mother and for me. They extended this courtesy to my brother who came in several days after I did. They made sure that whatever we needed we received. They allowed me to extend my stay at the same discounted rate when we found out that Mom's stay would be longer. The rooms were very clean and the staff were friendly and accomodating. I would highly reccommend this hotel to everyone and I plan on returning to San Diego with my daughter and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here complete rip off. Rates are made up on the spot. The "good" ratings on the site are written by the employees. All work there is half-assed. The owners are greedy lying jerks. Avoid this hotel at all cost which shouldnt be too hard because the rates are way to high for this dump! Rates are seriously made up on the spot, with fake discounts given i.e. rate was advertised as 60 now its 100 so we will give you a 30% discount and only charge you 70! What a deal NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: stormin1004
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely not what we expected. I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a business convention. There was no iron available, even though they advertised that there were irons. It doesn't look too professional showing up to a business convention in a super wrinkled shirt. There was no place to park. They hotel was full and there is definitely not enough parking. We had grass hoppers in our room. Our colleagues stayed at this hotel, and when they walked into their non-smoking room it was filled with cigarette smoke and two butts were on the dresser. The staff was very unwilling to move rooms or compensate for the cituation (the cigarette smoke made one of the colleagues nauseous).

Reviews.Title: “pleasurable experience and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFun21
Reviews.Content: This was one of my best experiences at a hotel.....great price, location and very clean. The staff was exceptional. The only problem we experienced was not enough wash clothes but compared to the rest of the stay it was easy to overlook. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Giggles718
Reviews.Content: I am becoming a regular customer at the Vagabond Inn on Hotel Circle when I come to San Diego. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the service is great. There are restaurants close by (but they offer fresh cooked waffles, cold cereal, juice and fresh fruit for breakfast), a convenience store right next to the hotel (microwave and fridge in each room) and the freeway is just down the street. The hot tub is like icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, clean rooms, and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: veryimpressedArizona
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good neighborhood and close to popular shopping destinations. The rooms were clean and included a refrigerator and microwave. The staff was very friendly and more than willing to help out with directions and ideas. The hotel offered a nice continental breakfast also. I would say for the price and location; my family and I will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Took The Pug Along”
Reviews.Author: Mitzipug
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I wanted to spend a night in San Diego before heading up to our cabin in Lake Arrowhead. That meant taking along the dog. The Vagabond was one of the few hotels that would accomodate a dog and didn't charge a cleaning fee or deposit (the site we looked at listed a $10 pet charge which ended up being $20). I could tell the hotel was recently renovated (the ruins of a building in the far back is the dog walk area) and I have to admit they did a nice job of it. My only gripe was that I requested a non-smoking room and a king size bed (cheaper) and they "upgraded" us to two beds, which would have been great had it not been a "pet friendly" smoking room. Even fresh paint can't cover up smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory service”
Reviews.Author: becca108
Reviews.Content: The 3 of us stayed at Vagabond Inn for 2 nights over a weekend and everything was average for what we paid for. The self made waffles in the morning, hot tub and heated pool were better than what I expected. Front desk was helpful but took a while to bring us extra towels. Would have been nice to have a sit down area for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: Roofs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a suite at the hotel. Everything was clean and quiet. The continental breakfast was great. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Vagabond Inn to others. A nice place at a nice price !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkHapytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, quite central for the beach/sealife ( 10 mins drive ) Friendly staff ( problem with safe in room but fixed straight away ) Comfortable rooms, not the Hilton but great for the money. Good choice of breakfast, make yourself waffles ( great ) cereal, fruit etc.. Two nice pools and one jacuzzi, great to relax arround after a day sight seeing. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: retiree00000
Reviews.Content: House was flooded so my 2 boys and I decided to stay at a hotel for one night while place was being worked on. Room smelled of smoke, wireless didn't work, and the front desk had given someone the key at 4am as if the room was empty. For the price, I would have thought they would have represented themselves better.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: elenaScottsdale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Vagabond while in town for the AFC half marathon. Little did we know it was only five minutes from the finish line. And, since we extended our stay, it was close to everything . . . the Zoo, the beaches, downtown. The staff was very helpful to all of our questions, the room clean and there was breakfast! We would definitely recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not extravagant, but very clean, friendly, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ERosenbrg
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Vagabond Inn in San Diego (Hotel Circle) the first week of August while spending two days at SeaWorld. The room was clean, comfortable, and reasonably quiet. The do-it-yourself waffles in the morning were some of the best I've had. The two desk attendants were very friendly and efficient. The pools were very nice, and very clean. The air conditioning unit was a little noisy, but definitely worked. Check in was a breeze (although our rate was strangely about $2.00 higher than the rate we had confirmed just the day before over the telephone). The biggest trouble we had was a semi-faulty room key card that was very fussy. One time it took us 25 swipes before the door unlocked, but typically the door would open with just 1 or 2 swipes. The parking lot was full to capacity at night. We were extremely lucky to have found a space at 11:30pm - and only because we have a disabled placard. Overall, we were very happy with what we got for what we paid ($116) and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to the Zoo with Grammy”
Reviews.Author: jatama4
Reviews.Content: My grandson is 19 months and wanted to go to the Zoo. Being on a Grammy budget I looked around, via phone, and found both the Vagabond Inn, and Meredith at the front desk, to be a perfect fit for our quick and fun trip. Our room was nice & clean. The only down side was that the secondary lock on the door was broken (the extra swing latch) but the old fashion chair under the door knob worked just fine. The other problem was that when I wanted to bath Austin the tub stopper would not "stop" the water. But with all of that we slept well and had complementary breakfast of yummy waffles in the morning with oj before we hit the road with full tummies and loving memories of a trip to the zoo. the Vagabond was all that Meredith said that it would be and fit both our needs and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, a pretty nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silver54
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel circle in July 08 to see San Diego. Rooms were nice, good beds and great shower head. One of the pools was closed but the other was open and was great for the kids. Close to Sea World and other San Diego adventures. Breakfast was so so, only cereal, pastries, coffee, etc. No place to sit so everyone had to take food back to their rooms. Staff was friendly, my daughter has a hard time accessing the internet and the staff was very helpful in getting her going.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mesquitetree
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Vagabond Inn in San Diego. The room had just been freshly renovated - new carpet, beds, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, bedding, etc. Everything looked warm and inviting. We were traveling with two dogs which usually presents a problem. Not here though. Our dogs were welcome and, I might add, at no extra charge. There is a nice dog walking area behind the motel. There are also two swimming pools and a spa on the property. The room rate was very reasonable, considering comparable accommodations in the same area. This location is central to most of the San Diego attractions including the dog beach at Mission Beach. We had a great time and thank the friendly motel staff for making our short stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vagabond!!!”
Reviews.Author: roxygirlCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had 15 women stay at the Vagabond while we attended a conference at the Cox Arena. EVERYONE loved their rooms! It was just remodeled with microwave, refridgerator, complimentary breakfast - and the staff was very helpful and friendly!!! It was a great deal for the price!

Reviews.Title: “friendly hosts”
Reviews.Author: roomn
Reviews.Content: The staff was pleasant; they allowed my folks (handicapped) to stay on the bottom floor where the room opens on to the pool deck. The rooms were as clean, the service was friendly. Swam with kids in the pool. Rates very competetive; close to good food and sports facilities, entertainment facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a leisurely stay”
Reviews.Author: Chyung
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and clean. Property well kept up (Including grass and flower beds). Breakfast consisted of waffles, cereal, juice, coffee and fruit--quite good. Too early in the season to take advantage of the two medium-sized pools available. Economical with similar quality compared to area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: liketotravelNy
Reviews.Content: I needed to travel to San Diego on March 7, 2008 in order to make a mid day cruise departure the following day. Upon searching for a hotel room at the harbor, I found prices to be much more than I had intended to pay. My travel agent suggested the Vagabond Inn as they have a good reputation and Hotel Circle was not too far away. I felt fortunate to get a room for one third the price of the Harbor Hotels. Upon arrival, we found courteous service and a comfortable and adequate room. Most importantly, it was clean and comfortable and quite suitable for our one night stay. There was a 24 hour restaurant and mini mart within short walking distance, a pool which would have been a welcomed relief had the weather been more cooperative, and a complimentary breakfast which many guests seemed to enjoy. I was happy for the coffee and a piece of fruit. My only complaint: There was no hair dryer in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved My Stay at Vagabond Inn”
Reviews.Author: cyholloway
Reviews.Content: Vaabond Inn is the most peaceful and quiet hotel located in this area. It's location is absolutely marvelous as you can get to anywhere in San Diego in less than 15 minutes from here. The maid service is excellent and they all speak English which is an anomaly for hotels in San Diego. I am very impressed with the quality of the washer and dryer located on property and the cost of $1.25 each is less than any other hotel located in the area. The dryer is excellent and you won't spend any more than $1.25 to dry any load no matter how wet your clothes are. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego and in need of such services.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Meredith and staff”
Reviews.Author: Harleylove
Reviews.Content: When arriving in San Diego, thought I lost my wallet and all credit cards. Meredith and the staff helped me by allowing my family back home to take care of things over the phone. Even though I found the wallet later with everything still in it I was relieved to have someone there to help me in a time of need. If I stay in San Diego again, I will definitely go back to where people went out of there way to help a stranger. Melissa

Reviews.Title: “Loved Meredith..”
Reviews.Author: drums77
Reviews.Content: Meredith is wonderfull,helpfull and made me feel right at home.She has an outstanding personality.and found me a room when all other places were full. The grounds and rooms are very clean. If and when I come back to San Diego you can bet that I will stay at the Vagabond hotel circle. Thank You. I give her Two thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Motel”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine048
Reviews.Content: See review of the Marina Inn, Pacific Hwy, San Diego which has the same owner, Vicky Patel, who let us move to the Vagabond Inn, Mission Valley from that Motel because of poor maintenance, noise and water damage. Upon entering the Vagabond Inn we were told the rack rate was $129 a night & with an AAA discount it would be $99. The internet displayed the AAA rate as $80.10. But Ms. Patel insisted that for us it would be $159 a night. I informed her that gouging is illegal (penal code 396(d)) & that I am an AAA member. This was during the San Diego Fire evacution. She agreed to $99. We checked out of the Vagabond Inn on 10/25 @ 10 am. The Motel refused to give us a bill saying it can only be gotten from the Marina Inn. We went back to the Marina Inn. They also refused to give us bill. Hotel.com said they cannot help. AAA can't help since it was booked @ hotel.com. We stayed one night at the Marina Inn and 2 nights at the Vagabond Inn yet according to my credit card company we were overcharged and pre-charged $725. We are contesting. Stay away from anything that is owned by Vicky Patel. The BBB shows a poor record for both places.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even make it to the room”
Reviews.Author: sctravelerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: When we made the reservation 2 days before we arrived, we asked the Vagabond Inn agent, "Please give us a room away from the freeway." Hotel Circle hotel rooms are notoriously noisy because of the I8 Freeway. The agent told us, "No problem. There are plenty of rooms, and we can do that." So we arrived at the motel, and yes, they had our reservation, but apparently had given all the other rooms away. All they had for us was a noisy room overlooking the freeway. I don't know whether they didn't include the note in the reservation, or whether they just ignored it and gave the better rooms to earlier arrivals. It doesn't matter. We won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Elaine_K_SA
Reviews.Content: I used to live in San Diego then moved to San Antonio in 2004. I return to San Diego for business every 6-8 weeks and have been staying at the Vagabond Inn San Diego during those business trips. The main reason I return is because of Leo, a long-time employee at the hotel. He always remembers me and my room preferences/ needs. Leo is also helpful and efficient with my reservations for future trips. As an extra bonus, the Vagabond has recently gone through an extensive renovation. The rooms now have new refrigerators, new airconditioners, granite countertops, new tile and carpet, and new mattresses. In addition, the lobby has been completely renovated. So, it's much nicer and more comfortable! I will continue to return to the Vagabond as long as I do business in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Much better and newly remodeled!”
Reviews.Author: Sketchyboi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property before, and this time around, the hotel stay exceeded my expectations!! I stay in San Deigo often for work and have stayed at many locations in the Hotel Circle area. When making the reservation, I spoke with Sherri, who was incredibly helpful and kind. She informed me that this hotel has been going through a renovation, and gave me a great rate to come and check it out. Once I got to the hotel, the front desk staff was equally kind and helpful. Merideth, who checked me in, made sure that I had a room that was catered to my needs, and also informed me of various places in the area that may be of interest to me. She went far beyond what is expected to make me feel comfortable about my stay. My newly remodeled room had a brand new fridge in it, as well as a brand new microwave and coffee maker. The carpet was new and so was the bed and bedding. I also received free wireless and a good selection of television channels. All and all, the stay was perfect, at a perfect price. If you are looking to travel to the area, and consider this hotel, just be sure to ask for one of the newly remodeled rooms and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Would We Stay Here...”
Reviews.Author: redhed
Reviews.Content: We saw mixed reviews on this property so decided to give it a shot. My husband checked in prior to my arrival and forewarned me...he said it was 'pretty tired.' When I walked in I couldn't recall how long it'd been since I stayed in a $129.00 night room that was so bad. The curtains had never been ironed. They'd been wadded in a ball somewhere and then hung up. There was a big 'brown smear' of something on the wall above the TV. The shower floor was incredibly stained. Carpet was old...linens paper thin. All night long (til after 3AM) there were people going in and out of all the rooms above us...stomping up & down the stairs. We were 3 rooms off the road...which is the highway. The noise was nonstop all night . If you decide to give this property a shot, ask for a room in the back. Room had a TV, microwave, coffeemaker. Breakfast was cereal, fruit, waffles, juice, coffee. Front desk seemed nice...but nothing could make up for this room....

HotelInfo.Name: Vagabond Inn San Diego (Hotel Circle)
HotelInfo.Address: 625 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
